issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: Once create a keypair with the name abc`~!@#$%^&*()_+0-+{}[]|\:;<>?><,., it cannot be deleted using euca2ools

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I could create an autoscaling group with backslash in name:  c\d  both from  UI and command line. This ASG completely ignored min/max/desired=1 setting and kept spawning up instances. Screen shot included.

{code}
[root@d-32 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group 'c\d' -l LC1 -m 1 -M 1 --desired-capacity 1 -z PARTI00
{code}

I was unable to delete this group from UI or command line:

{code}
[root@d-32 ~]# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group 'c\d' --debug
2014-07-23 11:07:24,172 DEBUG   DeleteAutoScalingGroup parsed arguments: {'force': False, 'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'AutoScalingGroupName': 'c\\d', 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'ForceDelete': None}
2014-07-23 11:07:24,173 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2014-07-23 11:07:24,173 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2014-07-23 11:07:24,173 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries
2014-07-23 11:07:24,173 INFO    Config   novalue for max-retries
2014-07-23 11:07:24,173 INFO    Config finding global option timeout
2014-07-23 11:07:24,173 INFO    Config   novalue for timeout
2014-07-23 11:07:24,176 INFO    DeleteAutoScalingGroup parameters: {'Action': 'DeleteAutoScalingGroup', 'Version': '2011-01-01', 'AutoScalingGroupName': 'c\\d'}
2014-07-23 11:07:24,177 INFO    AutoScaling sending request (attempt 1 of 3)
2014-07-23 11:07:24,178 DEBUG   QuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\nautoscaling.d-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773\n/\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKIBYPGVLQQII3T0VPRB&Action=DeleteAutoScalingGroup&AutoScalingGroupName=c%5Cd&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2014-07-23T18%3A07%3A24Z&Version=2011-01-01'
2014-07-23 11:07:24,178 DEBUG   QuerySigV2Auth b64-encoded signature: yRPkf0YzfIyCHlhyVBJ8yNLNMcb1Xl36+DHq7Hgl+VU=
2014-07-23 11:07:24,178 DEBUG   QuerySigV2Auth converting params to POST data
2014-07-23 11:07:24,185 DEBUG   AutoScaling request method: POST
2014-07-23 11:07:24,186 DEBUG   AutoScaling request url:    http://autoscaling.d-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
2014-07-23 11:07:24,186 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Content-Length: 253
2014-07-23 11:07:24,186 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
2014-07-23 11:07:24,186 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Host: autoscaling.d-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773

fields.summary: Backslash in Autoscaling group name causes the group to ignore min/max/desired setting. ASG keeps launching instances and can not be deleted.

comments.body: This underlying cause is most likely the same as that for EUCA-9268.
You should set the desired capacity to 0 before deleting the group (euscale-set-desired-capacity -c 0 NAME)
[~sjones] I tried setting desired capacity to 0 and then deleting. ASG still was not deleted. In the group there is a large number of instances (~1500) that is marked in pending state.
There is similar behavior with Key Pairs as well.  If I include the backslash in the key name, I am unable to delete it after.  The .pem file also failed to download.
